data.text: This place is paradise on earth. Incredible facility, swimming area’s for young and old, super friendly staff, superb restaurants, and nice hotel rooms. BUT when you get ill, avoid the on-site Clinic. This is a scam with outrageous tariffs. Pure Mafia.
data.title: Real gem with 1 sharp edge - be aware

data.text:
Last day at Aqua Viva and it has been a great holiday thanks to the lovely staff. 

Great hotel and waterpark layout, lots to do with noisy entertainment for those who need it. Good has been great, especially the Italian and Egyptian restaurants which were outstanding, the buffet has also been great for all three meals. 

Sadly the only downside has been a small minority of very loud, inconsiderate Brits who complain about everything, row loudly at each other and reserve sunbeds for hours without actually using them. 

We would absolutely recommend the hotel, it is lovely and our family swim up was absolutely perfect for us with plenty of shade in the afternoons and a lovely view across Makadi and the Red Sea.
data.title: Almost perfect

owner_response.title: Owner response

The appreciating your special praise for our staff and food.

Looking forward of welcoming you once again. 

Best regards
Jaz Aquaviva Team
owner_response.author: Ayman Anis

data.text:
Great family hotel and also great for couples. Loads for the family to do as it has a massive water park, big main pool and a beach which is a short bus ride away.
There is an adults only area on the roof above the main restaurant and you can visit one of the themed restaurants on the complex, one per stay think there’s about seven different ones to chose from. You can also pay for them if you want to go again, it’s not to expensive we done the pan Asian twice, the Italian twice and the Indian once, would highly recommend them all. The hotel is really nice, the rooms could do with a bit of updating but you don’t spend too much time in the room anyway. The staff here are brilliant and try their best to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
data.title: Couple’s relaxing holiday

owner_response.title: Owner response

We are looking forward to see you back in our hotel.

Aquaviva Hotel team
owner_response.author: Ayman Anis

data.text:
Wonderful trip taken end March with our family- 40+ couple, father, two teens and a 4 year old! There was something for everyone. The staff were all lovely and great entertainers of the young and old 🤣, the hotel very clean, sleek and welcoming, the waiting staff and food options superb and the facilities throughout the resort all fantastic. The a la carte was difficult to book in to but guest relations helped and we eventually got there! 
The water park was great and amused all our family, even our difficult 4 year old, the beach was fabulous - once we figured out where we were going! The pools - just wow- we especially liked the area near the Viva bar. We never managed to acquire sunbeds around the main pool, but didn’t really mind- there’s so much space else where. 
Our excursions were all out of this world and the staff on them second to none too! Pool side staff very careful regarding safety and not allowing any unruliness - which was a refreshing change, although the families visiting were all generally lovely with very kind and courteous children with our youngest (especially German 🇩🇪 children). 
Overall a superb trip we were all sad to leave; our littlest wanted to “stay on my holiday forever”.

A few tips- 
• Politeness to the staff is not unnoticed and they appreciate a smile and a thank you!! (Note- don’t be entitled rude beasts!) 
•Tip small but often, pounds, dollars and euros are widely accepted and the cash machines outside dispense Egyptian pounds. Take pound coins for when you first arrive- especially for the airport and transfer.
•The usual reserving of beds is an issue, but the pool team do go above and beyond to try to help and there are so many areas to relax, not just the main pool area.
•If you have any issues- talk to the staff- they will do absolutely anything to help. 
•On most trips there is photography- the cost varies between 35 and 70 euros and you don’t find out on the cost until the end of the trip! It’s rare that you’ll see the images beforehand (although we did on the scuba trip), so don’t rely on these as your images if you don’t want to pay these prices! 

We really hope to return in the near future. Thank you team Jaz Aquaviva for a fantastic stay, special mention to Ahmed in housekeeping, Ahmed in waiting service and the head chef/management in the food court!
data.title: Amazing family holiday

owner_response.author: Ayman Anis

data.text:
I have been to Egypt many times but this was one of the best experiences I have had in a family resort. We stayed here for 10 days as a family. 

The food and drinks were really good, the entertainment team were amazing! Very interactive for children and adults, getting everyone involved in all the entertainment and activities. The entertainment team, especially David were very friendly, smiley and happy all the time. They made us feel welcomed from the moment we got here, until the moment we left. We will definitely be returning in the future for another family holiday. 

The waterpark and beach was a perfect way to break up the days of sunbathing. 

The bar staff especially Ismail was very friendly and would deliver drinks to wherever we were sat. This is a perfect family all inclusive resort.
data.title: Family Holiday
